item.description:
The Friends of Myles Standish State Forest (MSSF) Native Bird Support Group is helping bluebirds by providing them with nesting boxes in several locations in the forest. Their populations have risen in recent years due to nesting boxes!

We are inviting you to help spring clean and install our nesting boxes for the MSSF Wildlife Management Area and surrounding spots within the forest. Meet at the Headquarter's picnic tables at 1:00 PM, Saturday, March 9th.  We will carpool to Cutter Field RD and a few other prime real estate spots. If it rains, we will be meeting on March 10th at 1:00 PM instead.  Volunteers are needed to help monitor Eastern bluebird boxes for the season as well. If you'd like to learn how to monitor nests, send an email to madshamel@gmail.com.  We will be holding a monitoring training meeting on April 6th.

Please bring a Phillips head screwdriver, a spray bottle with water and half a cup of white vinegar mix, and gloves if you have some.  Also, don't wear good clothes, as we might get a little dirty.

This date will not be cancelled unless it is pouring/snowing heavily.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for us at the picnic tables in the headquarter's parking lot

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Bird box installation
